alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots, frequent lightning and hail up to 2 centimetres are expected or occurring in the area.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Take cover immediately, if threatening weather approaches.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots, frequent lightning and hail up to 2 centimetres are expected or occurring in the area.

An area of thunderstorms located south of Burnt Island is moving east across the area at 25 knots.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Take cover immediately, if threatening weather approaches.

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain.

###

Local utility outages are possible. Damage to roofs, fences, branches or soft shelters is possible.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
alerts.instruction:
When thunder roars, go indoors! Lightning kills and injures Canadians every year.

Emergency Management Ontario recommends that you take cover immediately if threatening weather approaches.

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain.

Hazards:
Wind gusts up to 90 km/h
Nickel to ping pong ball sized hail
Heavy rainfall

When:
This evening.

###

Local utility outages are possible. Damage to roofs, fences, branches or soft shelters is possible.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
alerts.instruction:
When thunder roars, go indoors! Lightning kills and injures Canadians every year.

Emergency Management Ontario recommends that you take cover immediately if threatening weather approaches.

alerts.headline: rainfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Rain, at times heavy, is expected.

Hazards: 
Local rainfall totals of 50 mm to 100 mm. 

Timing: 
Ending this evening. 

Discussion: 
Showers and thunderstorms will continue to affect the area into this evening. Some areas have already received nearly 50 mm. 

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots, frequent lightning and hail up to 2 centimetres are expected or occurring in the area.

An area of thunderstorms located south of Misery Bay is moving east across the area at 25 knots.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Take cover immediately, if threatening weather approaches.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots are expected or occurring in the area.

Wind gusts up to 35 knots are expected with thunderstorms moving eastwards at 25 knots.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.
